Articles.Content:
KRC(Kerbal Research Center) Presenting the Strover rover Series.

Size comparison to the Strover MK1 Prototype:

Strover MK1

------------------------

View the Strover MK1; Front:

Side:

Description:

The MK1 of it's series provides a Remote Guidance system for un-manned machines, and four(4) RoveMax Model XL3's which give the MK1 the maximum amount of clearance for those pesky mountain tops and when you need to rest the MK1 has four(4) LT-2 Landing Struts for maximum stability. The MK1 is easy to use so even the most challenged can use it. The MK1 also comes slandered with two(2) Communotron 88-88's for maximum distnce of radio contact, along with one(1) Double-C Accelerometer, one(1) 2HOT Thermometer, and one(1) GRAVMAX Negative Gravioli Detector.

Get the Strover MK1 Here: http://www./download/1num5vpu3qm9a1n/Strover_MK1.rar

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Strover MK2

-----------------

View the Strover MK2; Front:

Side:

Description:

The Strover MK2 is very similar to the MK1 but contains larger secondary wheels and the ability to remove it's primary wheels.

Get The Strover MK2 Here: http://www./download/bmbe10bsb6yc9v1/Strover_MK2.rar

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Strover MK3

----------------

Strover Rover MK3; Front;

Side:

Top/Above:

The MK 3 of the Strover series. this rover was designed with one thought in mind, how can I transport multiple Kerbals from one point to the other.

The MK3 can hold 11 Kerbals.

The strover MK3 uses four (4) TR-2L Vehicular Wheels, one (1) Communotron 88-88, one (1) Double-C Accelerometer, one (1) PressMat Barometer, one (1) GRAVMAX Negative Gravioli Detector, one (1) 2HOT Thermometer, two (2) Clamp-O-Tron Shielded Docking Ports, two (2) Gigantor XL Solar Array, two (2) SP-w 2x3 Photovoltaic Panels, two (2)SP-w 1x6 Photovoltaic Panels, four (4) LT-2 Landing Struts ( for that pesky quicksand, one (1) Probodobodyne OKTO2, one (1) Inline Advanced Stabilizer (aka Advanced SAS), ten (10) Illuminator MK1's, And one (1) Clamp-O-Tron.

Action Groups:

1 - All Solar Panels

2 - All Laders

3 - Toggles All four sensors, and exteds all Communotron's

Abort does not do anything, there is no RCS, don't slam on the brake as this rover tends to go end over end (hence the length), this rover was intended for the moon but can be used on any planet, you can strap this to a rocket and it should fly fine, though saying that I would recommend using Mech-Jeb on this craft, obviously I have gotten this craft to the moon without it, but it was a hassle.

Get It Here: http://www./download/6kte0ovuscqk4z1/Strover_MK3.zip

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A big Thank you to the brave Test Pilots:

Caldon Kerman(MIA)

Jebediah Kerman

---------------------------------------

Caldon Kerman was atop Strover Mountain, adjacent to Stover Rover Mountain, overlooking KSC when Scientists say a Experimental Warp drive went off taking Caldon and the Strover MK1 Prototype with him into nothingness.

This Page (if possible) will be updated with new Strover rovers when new ones are made.

Edited August 7, 2013 by charliesuper
